definition: to coordinate closely/to act in close partnership with
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
surname Mi/name of an ancient state
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Work closely with HQ in France and with Finance Dept.
sentences.chinese: 與法國總部和財務部門緊密配合。

sentences.english: The maintenance of a kosher program requires the close involvement of production people.
sentences.chinese: 潔食認證過程需要生產人員的緊密配合。

sentences.english: Close coordination with the natural environment is his most distinguishing features of architectural works .
sentences.chinese: 同自然環境的緊密配合則是他的建築作品的最大特色。

sentences.english: I agree to work closely with schools.
sentences.chinese: 我贊成要緊密配合學校的教育。

sentences.english: The style of the UIshould match the tone of the game.
sentences.chinese: UI的風格應該和遊戲的調調緊密配合。
